metadata.commander_name: Major-General Ashton Gerard Oswald Mosley Mayne

narrative.title: 5Th Indian Division - 1942Q1
narrative.situation: British Infantry Division (Indian Army) deployed in North Africa during 1942Q1.
narrative.objectives: General purpose infantry division (Indian Army establishment). Veteran of East African Campaign. In garrison on Cyprus January-February 1942, then redeployed to Egypt in March. Held as Eighth Army reserve during Gazala preparation period. Prepared for mobile desert warfare operations.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Cyprus (January-February): Mediterranean island terrain, coastal plains, rocky hills. Egypt (March): Desert transition, prepared for Western Desert operations

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Mixed British and Indian units providing flexible command structure
High morale and combat experience from East African Campaign victories
Trained for desert and mountain warfare
Good march discipline and logistics management

environment.terrain_type: Cyprus (January-February): Mediterranean island terrain, coastal plains, rocky hills. Egypt (March): Desert transition, prepared for Western Desert operations
